runs.comm: and that's a decent start for AB, short ball on the hip and he flicks it away over short fine leg...nearly carries for six
responds with a shorter ball, a full on bouncer, better directed over middle and off, AB has to be careful not to topple onto his stumps as he sways out of the line
full, down the leg side, called wide
big appeal for caught down the leg side as AB pulls at another shortish delivery on his hip, England are very excited by it...but replays show that it came off his hip
flung down the leg side again, can't afford these
better line and length, on middle, defended into the covers
that's big! Anything Buttler can do, we know AB can do as well...not quite into the second tier, but a beautiful pick-up over midwicket as Topley goes fuller and it's in the slot
on the pads again, deflects fine past the keeper
back of a length at off stump, pushed into the covers
short of a length, angled down the leg side, but it glances the pad on the way to Buttler so saves Stokes the wide (although could easily have been tickled for four as well)
just over mid-on...Amla aiming to flick a full delivery over the leg side, legs it straighter than he wanted but he just has the legs to evade Moeen Ali

fuller outside off, squirted into the off side and there's some brilliant work by Stokes off his own bowling as he cuts across from his follow through, collects the ball around short midwicket, turns and produces a direct hit...but Amla is safety home
full at off stump, a lovely sweet drive but straight to cover
short of a length, angled into the body, bounces off the thigh into the leg side so he can keep the strike with a leg bye
starts with a short ball, AB pulls and gets a fair chunk of top edge, similar to the dismissal two days ago but this falls into space deep on the leg side
that is hammered...short again, this time it comes right out of the middle as de Villiers pulls it thunderously through square leg
oh, what a strike! Jordan goes fuller, de Villiers uses his feet and the drives it sweetly high over mid-off and it hits the boundary-marker on the full
he's aiming this one out of the ground, but doesn't connect, was full again from Jordan
gets this over the off side, pushed even fuller outside off, wide as well, but there is a touch of swing although it doesn't hamper AB who opens the face at the last moment to send it over cover
that's brutal! De Villiers at his best. Jordan drags the length back, de Villiers gives him the charge and swats him high over the deep square leg boundary
full, at the popping crease, jabbed into the leg side off the toe end
now it's Amla's turn, a lovely, classy lofted cover drive...holds his position and drives through the line of a full delivery
touch tight to off stump, worked with extra bottom hand towards mid-on who is on the edge of the circle
full toss, whipped just over midwicket which fearsome power and timing
forces him to defend - which is notable - as he plays a length ball at off stump to point
gets a touch of fortune this time, swings hard at a length ball and gets a bottom edge past the stumps and the keeper
that's a poor delivery, short again from Jordan and Amla is able to swivel on a well-controlled pull wide of short fine-leg and deep square can't get around
tries to correct and goes too far the other way, it's a slower ball which is dragged wide outside off
full and wide again, Amla chases it but still (correctly) called a wide...Jordan rattled at the moment
effortless from Amla as he leans into a square drive that bisects the gap at square cover and whistles to the boundary
wonderful batting! Jordan goes fuller and straighter, Amla shuffles across the crease a little then uses his wrists to flick it delightfully through square leg
finds the gap through the off side again, eases into a full delivery outside off, lovely placement with a deft turn of the face to place the ball wide of cover
back of a length, he gets a dot ball in - ironic cheers from the crowd - as Amla pushes to cover
full and straight, takes a thick outside edge down to third man
another super stroke, a lovely contrasting watching these two bat, as Stokes lofts a full deliver over the off side, opening the face at the last moment...carries all the way
touch more power in this stroke, similar ball and he slices it slightly square...not a million miles from a leaping cover
that really isn't too bad a delivery, it's full but Amla just places it through the cover ring and it races away from someone as quick over the ground as Jordan
massive appeal for a glove down the leg side but nothing going for England...there was a noise, might have been armguard. Close to the glove. Looks like a very good decision
turns a full, straight delivery into midwicket
full at off stump, he defends (yes, that's not a typo) but he still steals a single to keep the strike as mid-on is caught on his heels

starts with a horrid drag down - front of the hand delivery - and that is launched out of the ground (I think) over the leg side. The box of spare balls is brought out. Goes in the gap between the stands. Hope all the cars are okay
gets this fuller and flatter, outside off, takes a bottom edge through the legs of Buttler and scuttles away
flicked off the pads into square leg and that's a 21-ball fifty for de Villiers. His fastest in T20Is. He's well and truly revived his season
short outside off stump, rocks back to cut and slices it to short third man
gets this wide of short third man as he slides off the outer half of the bat as he steps back and drives...that's a hundred stand in less than seven overs
clubbed through the leg side
back of a length, shovelled into the leg side
tucks a straight delivery into midwicket
launched down the ground...full outside off, it's a slower ball, fair to say he picked it. Held himself for a fraction longer and then just drove through the line
into the crowd again, full outside leg stump, de Villiers almost ends up playing this down on one knee as he, in effect, sweeps it over fine leg
low full toss, drilled down to long on
full, down the leg side, he'll have to bowl that again...Topley not having a great birthday
on the pads again, a freebie for Amla but it's still delightfully played as he uses a late flick of the wrists to send it fine of deep square
short outside off, hammered in front of the cover sweeper
he won't get a hundred...aims to clear the off-side boundary again, the bottom hand comes off the bat and he slices the drive towards long off who takes a simple catch
huge appeal for lbw! Looked pretty good first up, full on middle and leg, straightened just a fraction as Amla plays forward. Think Rashid may be a touch hard done by there
flicked off the pads to deep square
full at the stumps driven to cover
leans forward and places this one out to deep cover
flicks a delivery outside off down to long on
driven back to the bowler
steps back, opens the face to ball outside off, there's a misfield at backward point
down the pitch, worked to midwicket
that's lovely timing and placement, drives a full delivery wide of mid-off with a late flicks of the wrists to open the face...all along the ground
bunted straight down the ground
defended towards mid-on
drives a wider delivery to deep cover
shorter delivery, it spins but Amla can rock onto the back foot and whip to down to long on
short and pulled firmly to deep midwicket
short again, pulled through square leg to take him to a 27-ball fifty
full on middle, blocked to cover
some turn there for Moeen, Amla takes his bottom hand off the bat and nurdles to the leg side
flicked off the pads to deep square
driven down the ground to long on
more spin, du Plessis comes down outside off, takes a thick inside edge into the leg side
swept from outside off behind square
short outside off, opens the face and pushes into the covers
full at middle and off, pushed to cover
missed stumping, another fielding error, as du Plessis comes down the pitch and is beaten by the googly...Buttler didn't pick it either. He was a long way down the pitch
played behind square on the off side
now Amla comes down the pitch and is almost beaten as this turns away, but but adjusts his shot and cuts to point
he opens up and dispatches a full delivery over long on with a free flow of his arms...stayed in the crease this time
cut to point
worked off the pads into deep midwicket, picks the gap between two deep fielders
outside off, tapped into the covers
driven firmly to the cover sweeper
flicked out to deep square as he uses his feet
that's a bit of a top edge, really, but carries comfortably into the stands over deep midwicket as he goes down on his back knee and slog sweeps
low full toss placed through the off side
full toss, straight, driven to deep cover
slower ball outside off, opens the face to the cover sweeper
back of a length, Amla gets inside the line and tucks to deep square
and that's it! Finishes things in fine style as he drills a full ball through the off side, wide of the sweeper
